ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] Blackbox Refiner
ygData.msgSnippet: I got my bootstutters pack at lvl 28.  It s an easy quest - just time consuming.  I don t think there is a lvl limit on the quest. BTW I handed in over 40
ygData.messageBody:
I got my bootstutters pack at lvl 28. It's an easy quest - just time
consuming. I don't think there is a lvl limit on the quest.

BTW I handed in over 40 pieces of scrap metal on Monday to Synfard (sp?)
and I obtained one glow rod (and numerous rusty weapons) but no trash
compactor. As anyone received one recently? In total - I've handed in
way over 100 pieces and have never received the compactor (and only two
glow rods total).

QdP

"Quasinom de Plume is my quasi nom-de-plume"

--- Tony Buser <gr0k@...> wrote:
> Nope, I was doing the scrap metal quest to get the rod and compactor.
> Tonight I'm going to try for the bootstrutter's pack. Only thing I'm
> afraid of is I might be too high level to start the quest.
>
> ---
> gr0k - Stranger in a Strange Land - http://www.juju.org
> Ubershadow Leprechaun - Level 28 Gnome Rogue
> Uberkniggit - Level 11 Troll Shadowknight
>
>
> On Mon, 6 Mar 2000, Zinken wrote:
>
> > From: "Zinken" <zinken@...>
> >
> > did you get the bootstrutter's pack ?
> > i was trying to do this quest today but Joglwas no where to be found
> :-((
> >
> >
> >
> > Askur on Veeshan
> >
> > ----- Original Message -----

> guy
> > > about blackboxes (I think I said "what blackbox") and he talked
> about how
> > > the blackboxes contain information which can be gotten only by
> useing a
> > > Blackbox Refiner. This is something I've never heard of before and
> he
> > > didn't respond differently to the words Blackbox Refiner or Refiner.
> He
> > > also talked about the Eldritch Collective useing them and I talked
> to
> > > everyone in ak'anon and the gnomes in the windmills and no one
> responded
> > > differently to it.
> > >
> > > Does anyone know anything about this? I think it was the scrapyard
> guy
> > > that mentioned it, either him or Manic in the gemchopper's hall.
> > >
